title: History and Electrocardiogram-only Manchester Acute Coronary Syndromes (HE-MACS)
description: Rules out acute coronary syndrome (ACS) using only patient history and ECG findings, without requiring troponin results. Stratifies patients into risk categories for ACS or major adverse cardiac events within 30 days.

parameters.name: acute_ecg_ischemia
parameters.description: Acute ECG ischemia (new ST depression ≥0.5mm or T wave inversion ≥1mm in ≥2 contiguous leads)

parameters.name: pain_radiating_right_arm
parameters.description: Pain radiating to right arm or shoulder

result.name: acs_probability
result.description: Probability of ACS or MACE within 30 days

ranges.interpretation: Very low risk of ACS or major adverse cardiac events within 30 days. Consider discharge with appropriate follow-up.
Low risk of ACS or major adverse cardiac events within 30 days. Consider serial troponins and further observation.
Moderate risk of ACS or major adverse cardiac events within 30 days. Requires further investigation with troponins and possible admission.
High risk of ACS or major adverse cardiac events within 30 days. Requires urgent cardiology consultation and admission.

references: Alghamdi A, Cook E, Carlton E, Siriwardena A, Hann M, Thompson A, et al. Enhanced triage for patients with suspected cardiac chest pain: the History and Electrocardiogram-only Manchester Acute Coronary Syndromes (HE-MACS) decision aid. Eur J Emerg Med. 2019 Oct;26(5):356-361.
Body R, Carley S, Wibberley C, McDowell G, Ferguson J, Mackway-Jones K. The value of symptoms and signs in the emergent diagnosis of acute coronary syndromes. Resuscitation. 2010 Mar;81(3):281-6.
notes: For patients ≥18 years with suspected cardiac chest pain within 24 hours
Not yet prospectively validated - use with clinical judgment
ECG ischemia defined as new ST depression ≥0.5mm or T wave inversion ≥1mm in ≥2 contiguous leads
Does not require troponin results, allowing for rapid triage
Part of the Manchester ACS family of decision aids
